Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, accessible”
Reviews.Author: Moscoman57
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. Room and total facility was clean, modern, well organized and staff was very accomodating. Free internet, plenty of parking, one block from a Starbucks. Had everything I needed for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Clean rooms, friendly staff, and good amenities.”
Reviews.Author: mrjaimes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days and the entire visit was very pleasant. The staff was very professional and hospitable. Rooms are very nice and clean. The continental breakfast was good as well. Very nice place. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for our pass-thru”
Reviews.Author: awhiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a pass-thru Indiana. Arrived around 10pm; front desk had our reservation ready as requested. Our two double bed room had an odd layout with big open spaces like a desk was moved out (but there was a desk in an adjoining sitting area). We missed the published breakfast hours but was able to grab a bagel, banana, and yogurt as we ran out the door. Entrance to the building from the road was not well marked, had to go through the Marriott parking lot next door.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: radtek2112
Reviews.Content: Very clean, modern hotel. Continental breakfast was good. Stayed at this hotel for the Indianapolis Marathon, and they opened the breakfast up at 5:00 instead of the usual 6:30 to accomadate the runners. Excellent customer service! Definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice change”
Reviews.Author: OntheRoad404
Reviews.Content: For being on an extended trip this room is by far the best. It has a separate living area divided from the bedroom. Its like being in your own mini apartment. (nicely done) I arrived at three this morning and the clerk was so nice. She knew we were the last of our crew to arrive, she asked if we wanted some food and opened up the breakfast bar so we could revive. She even had fresh coffee made in the middle of the night. There are extra fluffy towels in the bathroom, There is even a homey quilt on the bed. I'm so happy I'm going to sleep now.

Reviews.Title: “Grandpa and Grandma and 6 year old grand daughter”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTravelerOhio
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Fairfield Inn when it was new several years ago and a couple of times since. It has been updated and well maintained. It is an easy on and off the Interstate to get to the attractions downtown etc. one of the reasons we stay here. The room was always clean. We were there during the week not a weekend. It was being used but several junior girls’ softball teams for a tournament. Breakfast was always a questionable situation. Even with the large area we ended up taking our breakfast to our room. The breakfast hour was under staffed. The person running the front desk was also taking care of the breakfast area. In fact the front desk always seemed under staffed but always helpful. The pool is a typical small Fairfield Inn inside pool. We tried to use it several times but as soon as the girls return from their games we gave up. We will more than likely come back here again if it meets our needs for location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & convenient!”
Reviews.Author: ninernationmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last month and liked it enough that we booked another night on our last work road-trip journey. Staff is courteous, rooms are spacious and clean. Beds are comfy. Breakfast is typical of mid-tier hotels, but breakfast area is spacious and clean. Right off of interstate and convenient to a lot of restaurants, although you'll need to drive. Streets are too busy to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: iantess
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights to attend the MotoGP races at the Indy race track in August 2011. It was wasy to find and about 30 min. from the track, the rooms were clean and comfortable. We used the gym, which was small but we could also use the gym at the Marriott next door. The pool we didn't use althought the water appeared clear, the bottom of the pool had spots/staining which was not inviting. The staff were helpful for the local grocery store and directions. The breakfast was ok, but more fresh fruit would have been great. The only annoyance was out room key didn't work twice over the five days and the staff didn't know why our keys has "expired". Our room was one the first floor, but it wa a pain to have staff try the keys not working and then re-issue. Overall, we didn't spend a lot time at the hotel, we were at the track watching the races. However, is you want to be closed to the track other hotels are much closer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Moderate Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysForever
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Fairfield Inn Indianapolis East before, and it always offers a convenient stopover on our way west on I-70. It is quiet, clean and welcoming, and offers a good breakfast with fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, baked goods, and microwavable breakfast goods. We had a room with a jacuzzi large enough for two people. The bathroom also had a stand-alone shower. I was disappointed in the toiletries provided in the room, which included small containers of shampoo, conditioner, and soap. Also, while the bed is very comfortable, the pillows are quite small. The room size was not large but comfortable. The cleanliness, breakfast, and bed quality will keep us coming back.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: mmplus
Reviews.Content: Stayed her during NCAA tournament and found it was a good choice. Room clean and quiet. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast usual Fairfield Inn choices--healthy and fresh. Mostly fast food restaurants in immediate vicinity. Felt safe, but didn't venture far in neighborhood. Price was reasonable. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Masahisa
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on my business trip. Room was large enough and room rate was very good, but other than that, everything was just average. Carpet seemed like just replaced to new one, and I found a staple on the floor near bathroom. If I stepped on it, I could have injured myself. Although this was a fault of the carpet company worker, but I can not accept it. The location of the hotel is about 15 mins east of Indianapolis downtown. There are not so many decent restaurants around the hotel. I would recommend this hotel, if you are staying here just for a sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Paper Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: BottomLine
Reviews.Content: We had enjoyed our stay up until woken up at 2:00 AM wth the next door neighbors making a porno. We heard doors slamming and wondered what was going on at at one point thought someone was being hurt. Should have called the front dest to complain but the walls are so thin we knew they'd hear us calling. Paybacks are a you know what - we are normally early risers and of course we ran the jacuzzi early as well as the hair dryer and television. We thought we were lucky having a room on the end - and only one room next to us - we were wrong. Walls so thin you can hear EVERYTHING. Didn't know Zack and Mira were in town! Service yes is slow - front desk staff was online in business area and it really seemed like we had to PULL her away. Overall - the place is clean but I now wonder as to the type of customers they draw. We'd stay there again only if we could let them know we prefer a VERY quiet room - and then only if they guarantee it for us. Unfortunately, we used our Marriott points for the room so there really is no refund for us. Broken sleep makes one cranky the whole day.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but cramped”
Reviews.Author: blessedabove
Reviews.Content: This hotel is jammed in next to a few others....rooms looking out onto the next hotel's parking area and rooms (could easily see the TV on in a room across the lot)... Small and full parking lot... The "suite" is really the size of a regular room, but divided, so the 2 halves are quite small... A busy place.. noisy.... very small breakfast selection. Only one person available for check in, meeting others needs at the same time. The bed was okay, but right next to it was the blowing fan of the AC, which blew onto the bed and blew the curtains open. If the fan (which was especially loud) was off, you could hear the noise of others in the halls, etc. Would definitely try another place if there's a next time. There are a lot of hotels in that area...which are convenient to Rt. 70. Maybe the HIExpress would be better.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: CEDARPOINTCHICK
Reviews.Content: My family and a friend of our daughter stayed here while we were relocating to the Indianapolis area. We were greeted by cheerful smiles and excellant service. We had a suite and the rooms were better than we expected. Our 11 year old daugher and her friend thought this was the best place in the world , since they had their own bedroom with tv and didn't have to be in a seperate hotel room away from the rest of the family. That is a concern and a scary thing for small children. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and the suite was very clean and nicely layed out.. My husband and I enjoyed having a safe in our room, We used it quite often when we went to the pool and also out to eat.. The breakfast was great and diabetic friendly, that is a big plus for our family since I and my husband are diabetic. It was a plus having a fridge for our medicine and also to keep soda and juice cold . Housekeeping did a wonderful job at keeping our rooms cleaned daily, restocked , and fresh linens and towels in place. This is a hotel that has easy access right off the highway. A big plus is even though they are next to the highway, once you enter you never hear the noise of the traffic. This is a place I would return to with my family for a get away or even for a girls week end get away. I highly recommend this place to any one ! Keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: chuckster2
Reviews.Content: This was an "in transit" stop. It met all our needs and it was very convenient to the freeway we were using. When in this mode, the free breakfast is a must and it didn't disappoint. Save some time to walk through downtown Indianapolis and try Jockamo Pizza, which is 5-10 minutes southwest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a fine overnight hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdmiller95
Reviews.Content: Driving in from Cincinatti, we called the marriot 800 number and asked for the most reasonably priced marriots on the East side, and we ended up with this one. Stay was uneventful in a good way. Pro's: - Cookies on check in - Very easy check in - Room was clean and bed comfortable - Wireless internet worked fine - Breakfast was fine in the morning, though it was a bit of a battle to use the waffle maker (waffle stuck to the maker), but staff member helped - The location felt safe and was very easy to get to Con's: - can't think of any really...

Reviews.Title: “Clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Jaxrabbit
Reviews.Content: Not in the greatest area of town, but easy to reach off the interstate. Very clean rooms -- a "mini suite," very nicely appointed. I fell asleep on the sofa while watching TV, just like at home!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: travelpassion
Reviews.Content: Standard Fairfield Inn with good, well appointed and clean rooms. Decent breakfast but small breakfast room becomes very crowded, we were unable to get a table and had to eat outside (additional tables outside). The hotel is a bit out of town and located on the edge of a commercial distric with an O'Charleys chain restaurant right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful after a long 26 hour trip.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisQ-UK
Reviews.Content: Having been delayed 8hrs flying from the U.K. and then diverted to Chicago, I had to drive down to Indianapolis, getting to the hotel at around 4.00am the next day. I had rang to tell them that I would be late and the staff just could not do enough for me, they saved me a parking spot outside the reception and a room on the ground floor also close to the reception. I stayed for five nights and was well looked after, the rooms are very clean, staff most helpful, nice gym and pool, no restaurant, but plenty nearby, try the Texas Roadhouse 1405 N. Shadeland Avenue about 5 minutes walk. Only 6 miles to downtown and Indianapolis Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the "bad part of town"”
Reviews.Author: 11messiah
Reviews.Content: I have been going to races in Indianapolis for almost 15 years. I never stay in the same hotel/motel because I have never really been satisfied with the accommodations or the location. Most of my stays have been in the Indianapolis East area, but I had stopped staying there because of the level of crime. well this marriott solves this problem. It is in a "marriott compound" with another marriott and has a guard. the hotel is beautiful, the suites are HUGE- 2 big TV's couch, fridge, microwave, coffeemaker and lots of room. I actually made reservations for next year already!

Reviews.Title: “Clean as a Whistle and Smelled so clean as we walked in the room”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMBrooks
Reviews.Content: WOW ! I loved this stay! We walked into our suite and it was huge - the bathroom was very large with a whirlpool tub and a full stand up shower. The floors in the bathroom looked like they had been polished by hand and the walls in the shower were spotless! I do not usually walk barefooted in a hotel - but this place was clean - Smelled great - bed was awesome comfort. I have this placed marked. When we go back and need a room in Indiana - we will be going here. We slept in so we missed breakfast -I can't tell you how that was. The staff were nice and it sits in a nice location close to I70 for quick access.

Reviews.Title: “Never a Bad Stay”
Reviews.Author: purplevegas
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Fairfield Inn for a second time, this time choosing a king suite. Upon arrival, the check-in process was very smooth and within five minutes I was headed to my room. The room itself was shaped a little oddly, with not much of a privacy wall between the living and sleeping areas, but the living area was cozy (if not a little overcrowded with furniture). Just between the living area and the bathroom was a mini kitchen area with a coffee pot, microwave, and mini fridge. The fridge seemed to take a while to get items cold, but they were definitely cold after they'd been in overnight. The bedroom was basic: bed, tv, nightstands, overstuffed chair. However, the bed was amazingly comfortable, as always. The bathroom was very large, with a nice, long vanity with plenty of room to spread things out. The shower had a curved rod, which made it feel larger. The showerhead had great water pressure and I never ran out of hot water. The only complaint I would have with this room is that the air conditioner was a little bizzare. It seemed no matter how much I adjusted the room temperature up, it would still kick on and run until the room was freezing. I think I spent most of the weekend in a sweatshirt - in August! I visited the complimentary breakfast area on Saturday morning and found that if you go early, there are plenty of options. There were bagels, yogurt, cereal, toast, and make-them-yourself waffles. Milk, juice, coffee, and tea were also offered. Overall, I really enjoy staying at this hotel and have made it my hotel of choice for trips to Indy. Being a AAA member gets me really good room rates and the service here is always fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMGus
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. I was traveling with my two young children and my mother and husband. The room we stayed in had two queen beds and a pull out couch. The room was comfortable and we stayed for two nights. There is a nice pool and whirlpool in the hotel and the kids really enjoyed this feature. My husband also enjoyed the free wireless internet connection in the room. I would recommend this hotel to a family with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fairfield Far More than Fair”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysForever
Reviews.Content: On a recent road trip, we chose the Fairfield Indianapolis East Hotel as a convenient location to I-70 and the southern beltway around the city. It is located in the corner where the two roads intersect. It was perfect for both budget and accommodations. It is located adjacent to the Marriott complex and uses the same entrance. The exterior landscaping is beautiful. The room and public areas were immaculate. We had a jacuzzi suite featuring a "real" jacuzzi large enough for two people. It was wonderful. They designed in shutters leading to the room to allow watching TV from the jacuzzi, but more importantly, to improve access to the water faucets when starting the tub. Privacy can be attained by simply closing the shutters. The room also had a large separate shower unit. The room also had a microwave, refrigerator, and safe. The beds were extremely comfortable, and even though I-70 was near, we heard no road noise. There are several popular restaurant chains nearby, if you choose not to walk to the Marriott's restaurants, and the desk has a list of nearby restaurants with directions available on request. This hotel was exceptional for this category of hotel, and we will definitely stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Bob_in_Campbell
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. I was upgraded to a mini-suite which was a nice size. They held a BBQ for us in the evening, which I hadn't expected. Basic burgers and dogs, but free nonetheless. I was on a road trip and found this to be the nicest hotel of the lot up to that point. Would definitely stay there again. The location is a bit odd, sharing a property with a full service Marriott conference center, and with little else in the neighborhood of interest. The breakfast wasn't appealing to me, but I walked up the street a bit and found a good omlette.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTGS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a road trip. The hotel is your standard Fairfield/Hampton/Holiday Inn Express. The A/C was a bit noisy, and was either too cold or off. Our room was a "mini-suite" which was actually an oversized room with a walled off area as you enter with a couch & TV. Small, but it offers a little privacy from the bedroom area. Breakfast buffet was as expected. Overall, no problems, but as an interesting note, the hotel sits in a complex of three Marriott hotels, with a huge deserted parking lot. A little unsettling! The hotel is easy on/off from the I70.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smokers - Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJohn6
Reviews.Content: This particular Fairfield has an interesting definition of what makes a room non-smoking. Apparently, all they feel is required for a room that has been smoked in for years, is a single pass with a can of air freshener. I can tell you from 2 stays at this location, it does not work and the rooms are quite disgusting. If you are a non-smoker, I would not advise a stay here. I found myself sneezing during the majority of the stay and had frequent headaches. The hotel needs a complete remodel of the rooms to qualify for non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Scorch685
Reviews.Content: I contacted this property directly 6 months prior to our stay. I was very specific as to what room I 'did not' want. I checked back with the hotel directly one week prior to arrival, and again specified what I did not want. I was told "Yes - we have you all taken care of. " When I checked in, I asked the desk clerk if the room was next to elevator and vending, I was assured, again, that it was not. I got everything in a room that I had specifically said I did not want. My door and the elevator door were adjacent, the vending machine was immediately outside my door, when I opened the window I had a nice view of a roof and a brick wall. This was room 223. The closet is about two feet wide - space is taken from the room because of an equipment area in the hallway. We were in town for our son's wedding - I did not sleep at all the night we were in this hotel - the mattress was very poor quality - I felt like I was holding on to the side of a cliff all night to keep from falling off. The next day when we should have been spending time with our son we were tied up moving to another hotel. When I checked out I was told by the person on duty that all standard double rooms were next to elevators - if I had been told that six months earlier I would have found another hotel. This person was very helpful in finding another room at the Marriott next door - but all I wanted was to have no hassle with accommodations - I just wanted to check in and then enjoy the weekend with my son.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Fairfield Inn!”
Reviews.Author: skyeport
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice in the last six months, and have been very impressed with all aspects of the hotel. I always stay in an extended king suite, which includes a king bed, a sofa bed, and two large televisions. The bathroom is also a very nice size. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job in preparing the room. The hotel provided free high speed internet access which easy to use. The hotel had a nice exercise room. It is part of a complex that includes what looks like an old Marriott. I ate at the restaurant in that hotel and it was not very good. They offered me an upgrade to the Marriott, but I was very happy with the size of the room and the comfort of the bed, so I stayed in the Fairfield. And the staff is very friendly! They welcomed me heartily each time, and knew I had stayed there before on my second visit. It is very likely I will be traveling to Indianapolis a few more times this year, and I plan on staying in this hotel instead of a more expensive hotel downtown. If there was a downside, it would be the continental breakfast. There wasn't much to it, and the juice wasn't working properly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Fairfield”
Reviews.Author: rockchalktraveler
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum member for Marriott I get the chance to stay in my fair share of Fairfields and this is one of nicest ones. Appears to be very new and the room I was given was very nice and spacious. Definitely would stay here again. Opt for this property and not the older full service Marriott across the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on a road trip!”
Reviews.Author: pjmcjm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Fairfield Inn & Suites on Sunday night, 6/26 while on our way to Cedar Point in Sandusky, Ohio. It is conveniently located right off I-70 in a fairly commercial area where there are lots of other hotels and restaurants. Damen's Grill in the Holiday Inn one block away is a great place for dinner! The hotel suites are well equipped with two TV's, refrigerator and coffee maker. The main living area is an odd triangular shape, but there is plenty of room. Everything is very clean and nearly new, and the bathroom is huge! On the second floor where we were, there was an ice maker, vending machines and laundry facilities. The hotel serves a very nice breakfast where you can even make your own waffles. USA Today's are available at the front desk. There is plenty of close parking available, and there is an indoor pool on the first floor. All of the employees we dealt with were quite nice and helpful. We had a very reasonable rate of $79 a night, and I would definitely stay there again!

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Indianapolis East
HotelInfo.Address: 7110 E 21st Street, Indianapolis, IN 46219
